marketNews.title: US Markets & Bitcoin Hit All-Time High
marketNews.content:
Two major US indices – the S&P 500 and the Nasdaq – recorded new all-time highs on Thursday trading (10 July). The S&P 500 closed at 6,280.46, up 0.27%, and the Nasdaq closed at 20,630.67, up 0.09%. The rise was partly driven by a 1.22% increase in Nvidia (Nasdaq: NVDA) shares, marking the first public company to reach a market capitalisation of US$4 trillion. Around the same time, Bitcoin also reached an all-time high of approximately US$118,000 as investors returned to risk-on positions.

The rally in US equities and Bitcoin was mainly caused by most traders ignoring the trade-tariff concerns announced by President Donald Trump. Steve Sosnick, Chief Strategist at Interactive Brokers, said that most market participants do not pay attention to tariff news until the tariffs are actually implemented, because they can still be renegotiated, postponed or modified for reasonable reasons.

In Asian markets, South Korea’s KOSPI also posted an all-time high on Friday (11 July) and has risen 32.4% year-to-date, making it the best-performing Asian market since the start of the year. Below is the performance ranking of Asian markets, including Indonesia, ordered from highest to lowest:

Key Takeaway

Overall, the rally in the US and South Korean markets was driven by strong enthusiasm for artificial-intelligence (AI) trends, which appeared to outweigh concerns about US tariff policy. For Indonesia, concerns over economic fundamentals and national growth prospects have kept foreign investor interest low, in our view. We assess that accelerated government spending in the second half of 2025 will be a key factor to boost the economy in the short term. In addition, investors should closely monitor the development of Indonesia-US trade agreements.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics You Need to Know
marketNews.content:
1. Reuters reported that the multi-currency loan facility up to USD 10 billion obtained by Danantara from several foreign banks carries an interest rate equivalent to the yield of Indonesian government bonds, with a three-year tenor. Five foreign banks have been appointed as coordinators for the facility, which will become the largest loan ever in Southeast Asia, each committing to lend USD 1 billion unsecured and without government guarantees.

2. The Deputy Minister of Coordinating Ministry for Food, Tatang Yuliono, said that the state-owned bank consortium (Himbara) will provide loans with a ceiling of IDR 3 billion per village cooperative in Merah Putih in the form of goods procurement, not cash, to prevent potential fraud in cooperative management. Meanwhile, the Minister of Cooperatives, Budi Arie Setiadi, stated that President Prabowo Subianto targets about 80,000 Merah Putih village cooperatives to be fully operational by December 2025.

3. Nickel ore shipments from the Philippines to Indonesia are expected to surge this year to meet smelter demand due to production restrictions in Indonesia, according to Tulsi Das Reyes, President of DCMI Mining. Reyes told Bloomberg that Philippine nickel ore exports to Indonesia could increase to around 5-10 million tonnes in 2025, up from the 2023 realization of about 1 million tonnes. He estimates the increase may not last long but could remain stable.

4. Danantara announced on Friday (11 July) that it has signed a memorandum of understanding with Japan Bank for International Cooperation (JBIC) to jointly finance renewable energy projects, water management, and power transmission in Indonesia. No further details were provided.

5. Bloomberg reported that Goldman Sachs Group Inc. forecasts Indonesia’s aluminium production could increase five-fold by the end of the decade as Chinese conglomerates such as Tsingshan Holding Group, China Hongqiao Group, and Shandong Nanshan Aluminum invest in new smelters. Alan Clark, a director at metal consultancy CM Group, told Bloomberg that Indonesia will become a global aluminium industry hub within five years, supported by cheap labour and coal-fired power plants capable of supplying large smelters.

6. Dana Brata Luhur (TEBE) announced that Dian Heryandi and Hendy Narindra Dewantoro have submitted resignation letters from their positions as President Director and Director of the company, respectively. The plan will be discussed at the shareholders’ meeting on 13 August 2025.

7. Jaya Real Property (JRPT) plans to conduct a share buyback of up to 100 million shares (approximately 0.78%) between 10 July and 9 October 2025, allocating IDR 80 billion for the buyback. The plan does not require shareholders’ meeting approval, following OJK’s relaxation to support market stability. Previously, JRPT reported a buyback period from 9 April to 8 July 2025, during which it purchased 23.3 million shares at an average price of IDR 708 per share, totaling IDR 16.5 billion.

tickerNews.title: MTEL and TBIG Report Possible Merger
tickerNews.content: Bloomberg reported that Dayamitra Telekomunikasi (MTEL) is again considering a merger with Tower Bersama Infrastructure (TBIG) after a previous attempt failed in 2015. Bloomberg sources said the two companies have held initial discussions with potential advisors about a merger that could create an entity valued at approximately IDR 90 trillion. However, Bloomberg also noted that the corporate action is still at an early stage and there is no certainty that the plan will be completed. Representatives of MTEL and TBIG have not commented, while Telkom Indonesia (TLKM), the controlling shareholder of MTEL, declined to comment.

tickerNews.title: TPIA May Receive Investment from Danantara for CA-EDC Plant
tickerNews.content: Reuters reported that the 800-million-USD chlor-alkali and ethylene dichloride (CA-EDC) plant owned by Chandra Asri Pacific’s subsidiary could become one of the beneficiaries of investment from Danantara through an initial loan of 3 billion USD. The initial loan is part of a multi-currency facility up to 10 billion USD from several foreign banks to Danantara. Previously, in June 2025 Danantara and Indonesia Investment Authority (INA) signed a memorandum of understanding with TPIA to explore the possibility of becoming a new investor in the CA-EDC plant.

tickerNews.title: ASII Reports Wholesale Vehicle Sales Decline in June 2025
tickerNews.content: Astra International recorded wholesale vehicle sales of 29,365 units in June 2025, down 33% year-on-year and 15% month-on-month. The result brings ASII’s wholesale sales for the first half of 2025 to 201,633 units, down 13% YoY, with market share falling to 53.8% (versus 56.5% in 1H24).

tickerNews.title: WIFI Posts Strong Profit Growth in 2Q25
tickerNews.content: Solusi Sinergi Digital reported net profit of IDR 145 billion in 2Q25, up 140% YoY and 76% QoQ. The result brings 1H25 net profit to IDR 228 billion, up 154% YoY. The 2Q25 performance was supported by revenue growth of 67% YoY and 22% QoQ, which improved all profitability margins. In 2Q25, gross profit margin rose to 77.4% (vs. 75.3% in 1Q25 and 58.8% in 2Q24), operating profit margin increased to 85.6% (vs. 59.4% in 1Q25 and 49.7% in 2Q24), and net profit margin rose to 51.6% (vs. 35.7% in both 1Q25 and 2Q24).

tickerNews.title: AMMN Ownership Reduced by PT Pesona Sukses Cemerlang
tickerNews.content: Ownership of PT Pesona Sukses Cemerlang in Amman Mineral Internasional (AMMN) decreased by 160 million shares (0.22%) according to KSEI data as of 9 July 2025. The transaction value is unknown. The holding fell from 6.52% to 6.3%.

tickerNews.title: DEWA Shares Sold by PT Madhani Talatah Nusantara
tickerNews.content: The shareholder Darma Henwa, PT Madhani Talatah Nusantara, sold approximately 361.4 million DEWA shares on 7 July 2025 at a price of IDR 75 per share, totaling about IDR 27 billion. After the transaction, PT Madhani Talatah Nusantara’s ownership decreased from 21.96% to 21.07%. Previously, the same shareholder sold about 666.7 million shares in June 2025 and about 493.3 million shares in April 2025, each at IDR 75 per share.

tickerNews.title: ENRG Announces Carbon Capture Project with PT Pupuk Indonesia
tickerNews.content: Energy Mega Persada announced that its subsidiary PT Pema Global Energi signed a memorandum of understanding with PT Pupuk Indonesia regarding the development of carbon capture storage (CCS) and carbon capture utilization storage (CCUS) facilities in Work Area “B”, which includes the Arun gas field in Aceh. ENRG stated that the Arun gas field is estimated to be able to store around 10 trillion cubic feet, or 504 million tonnes of CO2.

tickerNews.title: FISH Plans 1:10 Stock Split Effective 10 September 2025
tickerNews.content: FKS Multi Agro plans to implement a stock split with a ratio of 1:10. The new nominal value shares will begin trading on the regular market and the negotiation market on 10 September 2025. The corporate action will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholders meeting on 19 August 2025.
